item.title: 4 Strategies To Remove Dead Code from your Ruby App
item.description: How much does it cost you to carry dead code? How do you find and remove zombie Ruby code? Use these 4 strategies to kill out all the dead code in your Ruby application.

item.title: Building Technical Wealth and Improving Legacy Code with M. Scott Ford
item.description: Are you working on Ruby on Rails Applications that are constantly on fire, overwhelmed by technical debt? What if you were building Technical Wealth instead? Learn which tools & strategies to work with legacy code effectively, remove dead code, and leave tech debt behind.

item.title: Testing Thor Ruby Required Options
item.description: There are lots of tutorials for building a CLI with Thor from scratch, but there aren't a lot of them on how to test Thor, especially covering scenarios such as required options. Learn how to test Thor Ruby options.

item.title: How to Open Source with Richard Schneeman (@schneems)
item.description: What does lurking and flossing have to do with contributing to open source? It's all about sustaining tiny habits. Learn how to use tiny habits to go from coder to contributor.

item.title: How to RSpec a Jbuilder response from a Rails JSON API
item.description: Want to write a Rails API controller test and make sure it includes exactly what your Jbuilder serializer returns? You need to enable `render_views`. Learn why in this post.

item.title: How does the Faker Ruby Gem Work?
item.description: How does the Faker Ruby gem work? How do you contribute to an Open Source Ruby project? Know exactly how by watching us do it live!

item.title: [Guide] How to Contribute to Ruby on Rails
item.description: Are you looking for an opportunity to get more experience as a Ruby on Rails developer? Make meaningful connections with the community? Learn the best practices on how to maintain a large codebase such as Ruby on Rails? What if you had a step by step guide on how to get started? Get your free guide and start contributing to Rails today.

item.title: The Surprising Way to Become a Senior Software Developer with Caroline Salib
item.description: What to do when you've been doing one technical course after the other, and still not making the jump to Senior? What are the non-obvious skills you need to be promoted to Senior? Listen to our conversation with Caroline Salib on how to identify the non-obvious skills to get promoted to Senior Software Developer -- and it's not another technical course.

item.title: What books on Ruby should I read when trying to move from Junior to Intermediate Developer?
item.description: Want to avoid going through lots of frustration when self-learning Ruby or any other programming skills? In this post, I'm going to share a few tools for your self-learning technical practice toolkit and get the most out of your continuous technical practice.

item.title: Why I need to join Get to Senior
item.description: A letter you can copy/paste and send to your boss for buying Get to Senior Cohort for you.

item.title: How to Write a Clean Order By Case Query with Arel on Rails
item.description: Do you need to write a complicated order by query on your Rails app? Here's how you can write an Order By Case Statement using Arel and keep things clean and reusable.

item.title: Guide: Quickly Debug a Ruby Gem with Pry and Git Bisect
item.description: A quick guide to help you debug a Third-Party Ruby Gem using `bundle open`, `pry`, and `git bisect`.

item.title: Smart Ruby Developers Don’t Ask for Advice. They Do This And Build A Reputation As a Result
item.description: Want to find out for sure whether you’re moving up the Engineering Ladder anytime soon or not? Instead of asking for advice, ask for Instructive Feedback. Here's how.

item.title: 216+ Ruby on Rails Open Source Applications You Can Use as a Reference
item.description: Have no idea how to implement a new Ruby on Rails feature? Or a Rails model? A migration? How to write a test? Here's how to effectively use 200+ Ruby on Rails Applications as a reference for implementing the most common things you need as a Ruby developer.

item.title: Climb your Way Up to Senior Ruby Dev with Fabiano Beselga
item.description: How do you get promoted to Senior level? How do Engineering paths work? Fabiano Beselga answered the most common questions about Ruby career promotions, climbing up the Engineering Ladder, and how to get to Senior level. Watch the conversation now!

item.title: How to find your Ruby Software Career Path with Mina Slater
item.description: Have you ever reflected on your career goals as a Software Developer? How often do you talk with someone who’s doing the kind of work you want to be doing? Find out how Mina Slater created her own role by taking advantage of her theater management background and expanding the impact of her work.

item.title: How to Create and Deliver a Technical Talk as a Software Developer
item.description: Wanna deliver a technical talk but don't know what to talk about, how to get started, and how to tackle public speaking as a software developer? Learn how to create a short tech talk following a step-by-step recipe that only takes 20 minutes. Plus, public speaking tips, how to reuse the content later, and keep practicing your public speaking skills!

item.title: The 1 Mistake Keeping Mid-Career Developers Stuck in a Loop
item.description: Are you stuck as a mid-level developer? Trying to keep practicing after work, but don't feel like you're learning anything? What if you knew the next steps for you to make the jump to Senior? Learn how to save time and energy by doing one thing differently today.

item.title: Get to Senior Crash Course
item.description: You’ve got the coding skills, you’ve got the experience. But haven’t been promoted to Senior yet? Stop waiting. Take the next step in your career with the (FREE) Get to Senior Email Crash Course. Get started now!

item.title: Unhappy as a Developer? How Not To Be Miserable with Dr. Randy Paterson
item.description: Do you suffer from Slack notification anxiety? On-call schedules and deadlines giving you nightmares? Learn how to deal with conflict at work and in relationships with Dr. Randy Paterson, author of The Assertiveness Workbook.

item.title: Ruby Code Quality with Ernesto Tagwerker
item.description: Are you working on Ruby on Rails Applications that are constantly on fire, overwhelmed by technical debt? Instead of being a firefighter, what if you could be a happy programmer again? Listen and learn exactly how to measure tech debt and take the right steps to immediately improve code quality!

item.title: "I've been stagnating as a mid-level Ruby on Rails developer"
item.description: Do you feel stuck in your Software Developer career, not sure what to do next? What if you were taking the next steps and building an amazing career for yourself? Take your career to the next level with Get to Senior!

item.title: "I've been stagnating in my current position as a mid-level Ruby on Rails developer"
item.description: Get hands-on experience with designing and architecting production-grade Ruby applications in the Software Design Workshop. There is a limited number of seats. Get on the waitlist and save your spot now!

item.title: Just Enough Hotwire with Chris Oliver
item.description: An introduction to Hotwire with Chris Oliver, from GoRails. Hotwire is the new way of making AJAX requests on Ruby on Rails. Learn how to build JavaScript-less Rails with turbo streams, Stimulus, and form_with.

item.title: A Tender Introduction to Ruby Internals with TenderJIT
item.description: A class on Ruby Internals and TenderJIT. Aaron Patterson (tenderlove) joined us on an Open Source Thursdays Expert Guest session to teach you about compilers, interpreters, and how to contribute to TenderJIT.

item.title: The Science of Expertise (Part II): A Better Way to Practice Ruby with Deliberate Practice
item.description: What does it mean to be an expert? How do humans develop experts skills? What is the difference between being an experienced developer and an expert developer? To answer these questions, let's learn from the latest research on the science of expertise and perceptual learning, and PL techniques to help you become a Ruby expert.

item.title: The Science of Expertise (Part I): Introduction to Perceptual Learning
item.description: What does it mean to be an expert? How do humans develop experts skills? What is the difference between being an experienced developer and an expert developer? To answer these questions, let's learn from the latest research on the science of expertise and perceptual learning, and PL techniques to help you become a Ruby expert.

item.title: How to Build a Developer Portfolio And Be Stuck Forever
item.description: Have you spent months building a tech portfolio to get your first developer job, but not getting any results? That's mainly because a portfolio is an endless project with no scope and no end-goal. It's easy to get stuck forever. How about building trust instead?

item.title: How to Improve Code Quality on a Ruby on Rails Application
item.description: Taking ages to deliver small changes? Constantly sacrificing code quality? Is it possible to ever pay off tech debt? Yes, it is! Learn which Ruby code quality tools you can use to perform static code analysis and improve code quality. This post is a summary of Ernesto Tagwerker's 'Trapped in the Tar Pit?' talk.

item.title: International Pricing for Ruby and Rails Books and Courses
item.description: Living in a country whose currency is undervalued, which makes it hard for you to afford a course priced in US dollars? Here's a list of resources that offer discounts for Ruby and Rails developers who earn a local wage (outside of the US). The list includes one-time fee and monthly subscriptions.

item.title: How to Learn the Syntax of a Programming Language When You Know How to Code
item.description: Do you have a hard time learning the syntax of a new programming language, even though you know how to code? Here's a quick knowledge transfer exercise to help you learn Ruby.

item.title: Learn Ruby on Rails Best Practices With One Exercise
item.description: You're craving some squeaky-clean code, but all you have for lunch every day is a big bowl of legacy spaghetti code. Here's one way to change that.

item.title: New job, new codebase. How do you even get started?
item.description: Are you joining a new company, and the codebase is massive and scary? Are you freaking out because you don't even know where or how to get started? What if you could feel comfortable collaborating with your new team, and confidently navigate any codebase? Here is a list of strategies to help you!

item.title: Examples of Successful Self-Taught Developers
item.description: Feel like coding is not for you? You're not alone. To give you a boost of inspiration, here's a list of a few successful Rails developers that come from unusual backgrounds.

item.title: How to write Badass READMES for your Github projects
item.description: Tips, examples and a template for writing simple yet useful Github READMEs for your projects.

item.title: The Unstuck Guide for Developers
item.description: Feeling frustrated with everything you need to learn? Feel like things will never 'click'? Try this surprisingly simple way to get unstuck as a developer.

item.title: Dev With No Experience? Here's one way to get experience today.
item.description: Beep. Another rejection. You don't have experience for an entry-level Ruby job. Worse: chirp, chirp, chirp. No replies at all. Are you tired of all of this? If you want to get real-world experience, apply this strategy to get different results.

item.title: Perceptual Learning == More Ruby Experts?
item.description: What does it mean to be an expert? How do humans develop experts skills? What is the difference between being an experienced developer and an expert developer? To answer these questions, let's learn from the latest research on the science of expertise and perceptual learning, and PL techniques to help you become a Ruby expert.

item.title: TenderJIT: A JIT compiler for Ruby with Aaron Patterson (tenderlove)
item.description: Let's work on a JIT compiler for Ruby that’s written in Ruby! We’re going to start building a JIT for Ruby from the ground up. First, we’ll learn how Ruby’s virtual machine works, then talk about the CPU itself. Finally we’ll start building a JIT for Ruby in Ruby. This session happened on September 30th, 2021.

item.title: One last thing: Confirm your Subscription
item.description: Confirm your Subscription to the Expert Session.

item.title: How to Contribute to Ruby on Rails
item.description: This post is a summary of the Open Source Thursdays - Expert Session with Rafael França. Learn how to get started, how to fix a bug, navigate the Ruby on Rails codebase and contribute to Open Source projects as a beginner.

item.description: Do you want to become an expert Ruby developer? Sign up for the hexdevs newsletter!

item.description: Contribute to Ruby on Rails with Rafael França, Rails Core team member, on August 5th

item.title: You're in!
item.description: Thank you for signing up. It’s great to have you here! 🎉 The Joy of Missing Out 😊 Here are some cool things we’ve created to help you become an expert developer. 📕 Are you afraid you'll be stuck forever as a mid-level developer?# Sign up for the free Get to Senior Crash Course and take control of your career today! 🚀 Want to get your career to the next level?

item.title: Why no one reads your tech blog and how to fix that
item.description: Why does no one read your blog? Do you want to know the answer? It's going to hurt, but the truth it's liberating!

item.title: Getting Started with Pry Debug in 5 minutes
item.description: Whether you're new to Pry or not, there are so many commands to learn! Get Started with Pry in 5 minutes and save hours of work next time you have to debug your code.

item.title: hexdevs Watch Party
item.description: Remember all those amazing tech talks sitting on your Watch Later list? Sounds more like a **Never Watch list**, right? ⌛🤭🤷‍♀️ So many great tech talks to learn from but you simply can't find the time to watch them. Now you do!

item.title: Open Source Thursdays
item.description: Contributing to Ruby Open Source projects with hexdevs and Ruby Experts.

item.title: Taking the Leap Into Entrepreneurship With Monica Lent
item.description: Building profitable online businesses as a developer with Monica Lent.

item.title: Unusual Tech Jobs with Brian Hall
item.description: Learning how to code on top of your existing skills will give you superpowers! Learn how to use your skills in other areas to land a developer job.

item.title: Why Michael Lynch Left His Job at Google to Become a Solo Founder
item.description: Learn why Michael Lynch decided to quit his job at Google to run his own online businesses, his Financial Independence goals and the experience of launching an online course.

item.title: Grow a Micro-SaaS to 30K MRR with DelightChat
item.description: Learn how Preetam Nath and Sankalp Jonna, co-founders of DelightChat, built a Micro-SaaS on the Shopify App Store and grew it to 30K MRR and +20K users in 14 months.
